code:
---
name: sequence_simulation
config:
    layout: elk
    look: neo
---
sequenceDiagram
    participant User
    participant Sim as MonteCarloSimulation
    participant Pool as ThreadPool/ProcessPool
    participant Engine as StatsEngine
    participant Result as SimulationResult

    User->>Sim: run(IoT_Industrial_ActuatorController)
    activate Sim

    Sim->>Sim: _validate_run_params(IoT_Industrial_EdgeNode)
    Sim->>Sim: spawn SeedSequences

    Note over Sim,Pool: Parallel Execution
    Sim->>Pool: submit chunks to workers
    activate Pool

    par Worker 1
        Pool->>Pool: single_simulation(IoT_Industrial_ActuatorController) × chunk_size
    and Worker 2
        Pool->>Pool: single_simulation(IoT_Industrial_EdgeNode) × chunk_size
    and Worker 3
        Pool->>Pool: single_simulation(IoT_Industrial_PLC_Logic) × chunk_size
    end

    Pool-->>Sim: collected results[IoT_Industrial_PLC_Logic]
    deactivate Pool

    Sim->>Engine: compute(IoT_Industrial_PLC_Logic)
    activate Engine
    Engine->>Engine: mean(IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream), std(IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream), ci_mean(IoT_Industrial_EdgeNode), ...
    Engine-->>Sim: ComputeResult
    deactivate Engine

    Sim->>Result: _create_result(IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream)
    Result-->>Sim: SimulationResult
    Sim-->>User: SimulationResult
    deactivate Sim
repo_description: Python framework to run Monte Carlo simulations and samplers
